rComments: One of the best profs in UTM. Easy to follow. If you don't skip class and just study a bit before midterm and final, you will definitely get A!! Highly recommend him if you want to get good marks.

Don't take his courses unless you've strong Chinese background. Never quizzed on class material, suddenly all on midtermfinals. If class avg's too high, won't hesitate to screw over weaker students by making mtf much harder. Said so himself when asked directly. Pointless to take if hoping to pick up a second language. Massive disappointment

Thought he'd teach in English like in CHI100, or at least gradually transition into Mandarin teaching. Wasn't the case. Hard to follow if Mandarin's not strong. Eager to clarifyexplain if help is asked for. Recommend taking the course only if you can speak conversational Mandarin at bare minimum, since he sometimes have unrealistic expectations.

One of my favorite professors of all time. He is really helpful and enthusiastic. Although he has a bit of an accent, most of the course was very 'kin-ere'. Also, he was always more than happy to explain things for students, and because of him I continue to study Chinese. ???????????????????????

Professor Chen teaches Chinese really well and clearly has a lot of enthusiasm doing so. the moment we met him on the first day I knew I would enjoy attending his classes. But you'd be sorely mistaken if you think he's a push-over or easily gives away marks. the class is not as easy as one would think but he really makes the class enjoyable.

prof. Chen is a really nice guy and he marks rather spontaneously since it's a language course. I'd definitely take his course again but if you have no background in Chinese, avoid his courses. they'd be way too hard for you.
